directions: Finely slice shitake mushrooms, bamboo shoots, and green onions.
Put spam and raw pork into work bowl of a food processor. Pulse until finely ground.
Heat 1 T. canola oil in a large wok. Cook the spam and pork on medium high heat until fully cooked.
Add the shitake mushrooms, bamboo shoots, soy sauce, and sugar, cook for 2-3 minutes.
Mix the potato starch into water, and add to the wok, cook 1 more minute.
Allow the harumaki filling to cool to room temperature.
To fill the spring roll wrappers, lay one sheet out on a cutting board. Wet the edges of the wrapper with water, all the way around the perimeter.
Place 2 T. of filling into one corner. Fold the bottom up over the filling. Fold the sides of the wrapper inward, and roll upwards across the cutting board.
Heat about 2 inches of canola oil in a small saucepan. (You will want to leave the burner on medium to medium high heat.)
Fry 3 harumaki at a time, 2-3 minutes, until golden brown. Drain on a metal rack over paper towels.
ingredients: 9 oz raw pork loin (2 small pork loins, fat trimmed off)
title: Harumaki: Japanese Spring Rolls with Spam
